description: Definition of custodial parent for FAFSA purposes
rule: Custodial parent is the parent the student lived with MOST during the 12 months before filing FAFSA
tie_breaker: If exactly 50/50, use parent who provided more financial support
remarriage_rule: If custodial parent remarried, stepparent income and assets MUST be included on FAFSA

description: How Chapter 7 bankruptcy affects FAFSA financial aid
asset_impact: Assets are sold to pay debts. After discharge, reportable assets are ZERO.
fafsa_strategy: File FAFSA AFTER bankruptcy discharge for maximum aid eligibility
efc_impact: Zero assets = lower EFC = more financial aid
notes: Bankruptcy does NOT eliminate student loan debt, but can improve aid eligibility by reducing assets

description: How Chapter 13 bankruptcy affects FAFSA financial aid
asset_impact: Debts are restructured, not eliminated. Assets remain but are encumbered.
income_impact: Monthly bankruptcy payments reduce available income
professional_judgment_opportunity: Can request income adjustment for bankruptcy payments

description: Federal law allowing financial aid officers to adjust FAFSA data for special circumstances
discretion: Financial aid office has FULL discretion. No appeals beyond the school.
eligible_circumstances: Medical expenses not covered by insurance

description: Types of income adjustments financial aid offices can make
adjustments_allowed: Adjust for loss of child support

description: Types of asset adjustments financial aid offices can make
adjustments_allowed: Exclude assets lost to natural disaster

advantage: In-state students avoid NCP waiver process

description: Standard template for professional judgment appeals
example_opening: I am writing to request a professional judgment review of my financial aid package due to [specific circumstance]. This circumstance has significantly impacted my family's ability to contribute to my education costs.

description: Required documentation for NCP waiver due to incarceration
required_documents: Prison contact information (facility name, address, inmate number)
Letter from custodial parent explaining lack of contact/support
optional_documents: Letter from social worker or counselor

description: How divorce affects FAFSA filing
timing_matters: If divorce finalized BEFORE filing FAFSA, only custodial parent info required
pending_divorce: If divorce pending, both parents' info may be required (depends on legal separation status)
child_support: Child support RECEIVED is counted as untaxed income on FAFSA
alimony: Alimony received is counted as income

policy_name: Death of Parent Impact on FAFSA
description: How death of parent affects FAFSA and financial aid
immediate_impact: If parent dies AFTER filing FAFSA, can request professional judgment to update
dependency_status: Death of both parents makes student independent (automatic)
death_of_one_parent: Student remains dependent, files with surviving parent only
life_insurance: Life insurance proceeds are NOT counted as income on FAFSA
professional_judgment: Can request adjustment for loss of income

description: Professional judgment for job loss or income reduction
typical_adjustment: Reduce prior-year income to reflect current income
example: Parent earned $80k in 2024 but lost job in January 2025. Current income is $0. Financial aid office can adjust FAFSA to use $0 income instead of $80k.

description: Professional judgment for unreimbursed medical expenses
eligible_expenses: Medical bills not covered by insurance
typical_threshold: Expenses exceeding 10% of income may qualify for adjustment

description: Professional judgment for losses due to natural disasters
eligible_losses: Loss of income due to business closure

description: Financial aid office can change student from dependent to independent in rare cases
eligible_circumstances: Student granted legal guardianship of sibling
documentation_required: Letters from social workers, counselors, clergy
notes: Dependency override is VERY rare and requires extraordinary circumstances

description: Allows families to exclude assets from FAFSA if income is below threshold
requirements: AND eligible to file 1040A/1040EZ OR someone in household received means-tested benefit
benefit: Assets are NOT counted on FAFSA (home, savings, investments all ignored)

description: Automatic zero Expected Family Contribution for very low-income families
requirements: AND eligible to file 1040A/1040EZ OR someone in household received means-tested benefit
benefit: EFC is automatically $0, maximum Pell Grant eligibility
